original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā cha (sabbattha cha), vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre cha …pe… avigate cha.🔽Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā cha sabbattha cha vipāke eka āhāre cha pe avigate cha  anuloma
translated: As root cause, six; as object, six; as predominance, six; as support, six; as proximity, six; as presence, six; as non-disappearance, six.🔽The direct order🔽The reverse order

original: 2.5.3.5.2. Paccayapaccanīya🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya 🔽vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The exposition

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho ganthavippayutto dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: Dependent on a state that is not connected with the strands of sensual desire, a state that is not connected with the strands of sensual desire arises, being neither a root cause nor a condition by way of decisive support.🔽At the instant of rebirth-linking in the existence with no root cause …

original: ganthavippayuttaṁ …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate🔽khandhe saṁsaṭṭho vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam pe ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate  khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: The two kinds of ignorance that are associated with uncertainty and with agitation arise in association with the two kinds of clinging.🔽The rest is as above.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Modes of Conveying a Numerical Category

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā cha, napurejāte cha, napacchājāte cha, naāsevane cha, nakamme cattāri, navipāke cha, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte cha.
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā cha na purejāte cha na pacchājāte cha na āsevane cha na kamme cattāri na vipāke cha na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte cha
translated: In the mode of “not as root cause,” there is one permutation; in the mode of “not as predominance,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as prior,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as subsequent,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as nutriment,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as kamma,” there are four permutations; in the mode of “not as result,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as jhāna,” there is one permutation; in the mode of “not as path,” there is one permutation; in the mode of “not as association,” there are six permutations.

original: 2.5.3.5.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: The Reversal of the Mode of Conveying Conditions in Direct Order

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā cha, napurejāte cha, napacchājāte cha, naāsevane cha, nakamme cattāri, navipāke cha, navippayutte cha.
analyzed: hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā cha na purejāte cha na pacchājāte cha na āsevane cha na kamme cattāri na vipāke cha na vippayutte cha
translated: In the mode of “root cause,” there are six permutations in the mode of “not as predominance”; in the mode of “not as prior,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as subsequent,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as nutriment,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as kamma,” there are four permutations; in the mode of “not as result,” there are six permutations; in the mode of “not as association,” there are six permutations.

original: 2.5.3.5.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: The Reversal of the Mode of Conveying Conditions in Reverse Order

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ, anantare ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka anantare ekaṃ pe avigate eka
translated: In the mode of “not as root cause,” there is one permutation in the mode of “object,” one permutation in the mode of “decisive support,” one permutation in the mode of “prenascence,” one permutation in the mode of “presence,” one permutation in the mode of “non-disappearance,” and one permutation in the mode of “inseparable connection.”

original: 2.5.3.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: Associated Cause

original: Sampayuttavāro saṁsaṭṭhavārasadiso.🔽2.5.3.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: sampayutta vāraḥ sa saṭṭha vāra sadisaḥ  pañhāvāra
translated: The associated cause is similar to the mixed cause.🔽… Question Section🔽… Conditions Direct Order

original: 2.5.3.7.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: Explanation Section

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root Cause

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— ganthasampayuttā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— ganthasampayuttā🔽hetū cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagato🔽hetu lobhassa cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagato
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ gantha sampayuttāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ gantha sampayuttā  hetū citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagataḥ  hetu lobhassa citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagataḥ
translated: A cause that is associated with the hindrances is a condition, by way of root cause condition, for a conditioned phenomenon that is associated with the hindrances. The causes that are associated with the hindrances are a condition, by way of root cause condition, for the aggregates that are associated with the hindrances.🔽A cause that is associated with the hindrances is a condition, by way of root cause condition, for a conditioned phenomenon that is not associated with the hindrances. The causes that are associated with the hindrances are a condition, by way of root cause condition, for the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness.

original: hetu paṭighassa cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu paṭighassa citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that is associated with the view-hindrance and is conjoined with greed is a condition, by way of root cause condition, for greed and for the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽A cause that is associated with the view-hindrance and is conjoined with grief is a condition, by way of root cause condition, for repulsion and for the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness.

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena
translated: A cause that is associated with the hindrances is a condition, by way of root cause condition, for a conditioned phenomenon that is associated with the hindrances and for a conditioned phenomenon that is not associated with the hindrances.

original: paccayo—ganthasampayuttā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ
analyzed: paccayogantha sampayuttāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ
translated: A factor associated with the fetters is related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries,

original: hetupaccayena paccayo; diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagato hetu sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽lobhassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagato
analyzed: hetu paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagataḥ hetu sampayuttakānam khandhānam  lobhassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagataḥ
translated: as a cause condition. A cause associated with false view but not associated with the fetters is related to the associated aggregates,🔽to greed, and to the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries, as a cause condition. A cause associated with grief is related to the associated aggregates,

original: hetu sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu sampayuttakānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: to resentment, and to the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries, as a cause condition.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— ganthavippayuttā🔽hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo;🔽diṭṭhigatavippayutto lobho cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭighaṁ
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ gantha vippayuttā  hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  diṭṭhigata vippayuttaḥ lobhaḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭigha
translated: A factor not associated with the fetters is related to a factor not associated with the fetters,🔽as a cause condition. Factors not associated with the fetters are related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries,

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: as a cause condition. Greed not associated with false view is related to the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries, as a cause condition. Resentment is related to the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries, as a cause condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— diṭṭhigatavippayutto
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhigata vippayuttaḥ
translated: A state that is unconnected with the fetters is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is connected with the fetters. A state that is unconnected with the fetters is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is connected with the fetters.

original: lobho sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭighaṁ sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena
analyzed: lobhaḥ sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭigham sampayuttakāna  khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena
translated: A state that is unconnected with the fetters is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is connected with the fetters. Greed, which is unconnected with the false views, is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates. Hostility is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates.

original: paccayo—diṭṭhigatavippayutto lobho sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayuttaḥ lobhaḥ sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca
translated: A state that is unconnected with the fetters is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is connected with the fetters and for a state that is unconnected with the fetters. Greed, which is unconnected with the false views, is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭighaṁ sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena
analyzed: rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭigham sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca  rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayutto ca dhammā gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena
translated: Hostility is a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: paccayo—diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagato hetu ca lobho ca sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: paccaya udiṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagataḥ hetu ca lobho ca sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: A state that is connected with the fetters and a state that is unconnected with the fetters are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a state that is connected with the fetters. Greed associated with false views and the greed that is associated with it are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: hetupaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagato hetu ca paṭighañca sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagataḥ hetu ca paṭigham ca sampayuttakānam khandhānam  hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that is associated with grief is a condition, as cause condition, for the kinds of states that are not associated with grief and for the associated aggregates.

original: Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena🔽paccayo—diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagato hetu ca lobho ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayutto ca dhammā gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa hetu paccayena  paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagataḥ hetu ca lobho ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam
translated: A cause that is connected with the fetters and a cause that is unconnected with the fetters are a condition, as cause condition, for a state that is unconnected with the fetters.🔽A cause that is unconnected with false view but associated with greed is a condition, as cause condition, for the kinds of materiality that are derived by clinging.

original: hetupaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagato hetu ca paṭighañca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ🔽hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa🔽ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagato hetu ca lobho
analyzed: hetu paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagataḥ hetu ca paṭigham ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ  hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayutto ca dhammā gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa  ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagataḥ hetu ca lobho
translated: A cause that is associated with grief and aversion is a condition, as cause condition, for the kinds of materiality that are derived by clinging.🔽A cause that is connected with the fetters and a cause that is unconnected with the fetters are a condition, as cause condition, for a state that is connected with the fetters and for a state that is unconnected with the fetters.

original: ca sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: ca sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that is unconnected with false view but associated with greed is a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that are derived by clinging.

original: domanassasahagato hetu ca paṭighañca sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: domanassa sahagataḥ hetu ca paṭigham ca sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca
translated: and the cause associated with grief and with repulsion, are related to the associated states, to the kinds of consciousness and the kinds of mental factors that arise together with it,🔽

original: rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Ārammaṇa🔽Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ganthasampayutte
analyzed: rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  ārammaṇa  gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ gantha sampayutte
translated: A cause that is associated with grief and with repulsion is a condition, as a cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: khandhe ārabbha ganthasampayuttakā khandhā uppajjanti. (Tīsupi mūlā pucchitabbā)🔽Ganthasampayutte khandhe ārabbha ganthavippayuttā khandhā uppajjanti, ganthasampayutte🔽khandhe ārabbha diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca uppajjanti,
analyzed: khandhe ārabbha gantha sampayuttakā khandhāḥ uppajjanti tīsu pi mūlā pucchitabbā  gantha sampayutte khandhe ārabbha gantha vippayuttāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti gantha sampayutte  khandhe ārabbha diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca uppajjanti
translated: Object condition means that a state that is associated with the fetters is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is associated with the fetters. The associated aggregates are a condition, as object condition, for the associated aggregates. (The three roots should be asked about here.)🔽The associated aggregates are a condition, as object condition, for the dissociated aggregates. The associated aggregates are a condition, as object condition, for the view-accompanied greed associated with grief.

original: domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca uppajjanti.🔽Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ
analyzed: domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca uppajjanti  gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udāna
translated: The associated aggregates are a condition, as object condition, for the repulsion associated with grief.

original: datvā sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati, pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati,
analyzed: datvā sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā tam paccavekkhati pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati
translated: A state that is dissociated from the fetters is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is dissociated from the fetters. Having given a gift, having undertaken moral discipline, having performed the Uposatha, he reflects on that. He reflects on the virtues he has previously established.

original: jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ paccavekkhati, ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti,🔽phalaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa,🔽maggassa, phalassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; ariyā ganthavippayutte🔽pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti, vikkhambhite kilese paccavekkhanti, pubbe samudāciṇṇe
analyzed: jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam paccavekkhati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti  phalam paccavekkhanti nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa  maggassa phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ariyāḥ gantha vippayutte  pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti vikkhambhite kilese paccavekkhanti pubbe samudāciṇṇe
translated: having emerged from jhāna, he reflects upon jhāna; having emerged from noble paths, he reflects upon the path;

original: kilese jānanti, cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ ganthavippayutte khandhe ca lobhañca paṭighañca🔽aniccato …pe… vipassati, assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha ganthavippayutto rāgo🔽uppajjati, vicikicchā …pe… uddhaccaṁ …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati, dibbena cakkhunā🔽rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, cetopariyañāṇena ganthavippayuttacittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: kilese jānanti cakkhum pe vatthum gantha vippayutte khandhe ca lobhañca paṭighañca 🔽aniccataḥ pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha gantha vippayuttaḥ rāgaḥ 🔽uppajjati vicikicchā pe uddhaccam pe domanassam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā 🔽rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena gantha vippayutta citta samaṅgissa

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A causally-related phenomenon that is unconnected with the hindrances is a condition, as object condition, for a causally-related phenomenon that is connected with the hindrances and for a causally-related phenomenon that is unconnected with the hindrances.

original: paccayo—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ ganthavippayutte khandhe ca lobhañca paṭighañca ārabbha
analyzed: paccayocakkhum pe vatthum gantha vippayutte khandhe ca lobhañca paṭighañca ārabbha
translated: The five aggregates that are the basis for the defilements of sensual desire and aversion that arise in dependence on the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense-spheres,

original: diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā khandhā ca🔽paṭighañca uppajjanti.🔽Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca  paṭighañca uppajjanti  gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayuttaḥ ca dhammā gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: are a condition, as object condition, for the aggregates that are not connected with views and are associated with sensual desire, and for the aggregates that are associated with grief and are associated with aversion.🔽A causally-related phenomenon that is connected with the hindrances and a causally-related phenomenon that is unconnected with the hindrances are a condition, as object condition, for a causally-related phenomenon that is connected with the hindrances.

original: paccayo—diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagate khandhe ca lobhañca domanassasahagate khandhe🔽ca paṭighañca ārabbha ganthasampayuttakā khandhā uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.)
analyzed: paccaya udiṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagate khandhe ca lobhañca domanassa sahagate khandhe  ca paṭighañca ārabbha gantha sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti mūlam pucchitabba
translated: The aggregates that are connected with the hindrances are a condition, as object condition, for the aggregates that are connected with the hindrances. (The root should be asked about.)

original: Diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagate khandhe ca lobhañca domanassasahagate khandhe ca
analyzed: diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagate khandhe ca lobhañca domanassa sahagate khandhe ca
translated: The aggregates that are not connected with views and are associated with sensual desire, and the aggregates that are associated with grief and are associated with aversion,🔽are a condition, as object condition, for the aggregates that are connected with the hindrances.

original: paṭighañca ārabbha ganthavippayuttā khandhā uppajjanti, diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagate🔽khandhe ca lobhañca domanassasahagate khandhe ca paṭighañca ārabbha diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā
analyzed: paṭighañca ārabbha gantha vippayuttā khandhāḥ uppajjanti diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagate  khandhe ca lobhañca domanassa sahagate khandhe ca paṭighañca ārabbha diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā
translated: and the aggregates that are not connected to the hindrances, but are associated with attachment and with grief,🔽and the aggregates that are not connected to the false views, but are associated with attachment,🔽and the aggregates that are associated with grief and with aversion.

original: khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca uppajjanti.🔽Adhipati
analyzed: khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca uppajjanti  adhipati
translated: Dominant condition means: A state that is connected to the hindrances is a condition, as a dominant condition, for a state that is connected to the hindrances. The condition being a pre-nascent, co-existent, or post-nascent state, a support, or a disappearance.🔽The condition being a pre-nascent, co-existent, or post-nascent state, a support, or a disappearance.

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ganthasampayutte khandhe garuṁ katvā ganthasampayuttakā
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati gantha sampayutte khandhe garum katvā gantha sampayuttakā
translated: A state that is connected to the hindrances is a condition, as a dominant condition, for the aggregates that are connected to the hindrances.

original: khandhā uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—ganthasampayuttādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhāḥ uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati gantha sampayutta adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam  adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being a pre-nascent, co-existent, or post-nascent state, a support, or a disappearance.

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A state that is connected to the hindrances is a condition, as a dominant condition, for a state that is not connected to the hindrances. The condition being a pre-nascent, co-existent, or post-nascent state, a support, or a disappearance.

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ganthasampayutte khandhe garuṁ katvā diṭṭhigatavippayutto🔽lobho uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—ganthasampayuttādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ🔽adhipatipaccayena paccayo; diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatādhipati lobhassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagatādhipati paṭighassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati gantha sampayutte khandhe garum katvā diṭṭhi gata vippayuttaḥ  lobhaḥ uppajjati sahajāta adhipati gantha sampayutta adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam  adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagata adhipati lobhassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca  rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagata adhipati paṭighassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, as conascence predominance condition and as object predominance condition. As object predominance condition: having taken the aggregates that are connected with the fetters as a basis, views that are not connected with the fetters🔽arise. As conascence predominance condition: the predominance condition of the aggregates that are connected with the fetters is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the kinds of materiality that originate with citta.🔽As conascence predominance condition: the predominance condition of the greed that is not connected with views is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the greed that is connected with views and for the kinds of materiality that originate with citta.🔽As conascence predominance condition: the predominance condition of the grief that is not connected with views is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the grief that is connected with views and for the kinds of materiality that originate with citta.

original: rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, predominance condition as object and predominance condition as co-nascence. Predominance condition as object is when, having made the aggregates that are connected with the fetters weighty, the greed that is unconnected with the false views arises. Predominance condition as co-nascence is when the predominance condition that is connected with the fetters is the condition by way of predominance condition for the form that is derived from the mind. The predominance condition that is connected with greed and associated with grief is the condition by way of predominance condition for the aversion and for the form that is derived from the mind.

original: paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ganthasampayutte khandhe
analyzed: paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati gantha sampayutte khandhe
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, predominance condition as object and predominance condition as co-nascence. Predominance condition as object is when, having made the aggregates that are connected with the fetters weighty,

original: garuṁ katvā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatādhipati🔽sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: garum katvā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagata ādhipati  sampayuttakānam khandhānam lobhassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena
translated: When, giving importance to, greed arises together with the faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, or equanimity, and with the aggregates that are associated with that greed, and also with greed itself. Conascence predominance: the predominance of greed that is not connected with views,🔽is a condition, as predominance condition, for the aggregates that are associated with it, and for greed itself, and for the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: paccayo; domanassasahagatādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ domanassa sahagata adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The predominance of grief is a condition, as predominance condition, for the aggregates that are associated with it, and for resentment, and for the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ garuṁ
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati dānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā tam garu
translated: A state that is unconnected with the ties is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is unconnected with the ties, by predominance through the object,🔽and by predominance through conascence. Predominance through the object: having given importance to, having given weight to, generosity, virtue, offering, festival,

original: katvā paccavekkhati, pubbe suciṇṇāni garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: katvā paccavekkhati pubbe su ciṇṇāni garum katvā paccavekkhati jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā
translated: having given importance to, having given weight to, the observance-day ceremony, he reviews it. He reviews the virtues that he has previously performed. Having emerged from the jhānas,

original: jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: jhānam garum katvā paccavekkhati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: When he has emerged from jhāna, he reviews the jhāna as gross. When he has emerged from the noble paths, he reviews the paths as gross.

original: phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: When he has emerged from fruition attainment, he reviews the fruition attainment as gross. When he has emerged from the attainment of cessation, he reviews cessation as gross.

original: nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ
analyzed: nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhu
translated: Cessation is related to the faculty of final knowledge, to the faculty of final knowing, to the noble paths, to the fruitions, as decisive-support condition. Eye is related to eye-consciousness …

original: …pe… vatthuṁ ganthavippayutte khandhe ca lobhañca garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: vatthum gantha vippayutte khandhe ca lobham ca garum katvā assādeti abhinandati
translated: … to the states associated with it and to greed as decisive-support condition.

original: taṁ garuṁ katvā ganthavippayutto rāgo uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—ganthavippayuttādhipati
analyzed: tam garum katvā gantha vippayuttaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati sahajāta adhipati gantha vippayutta adhipati
translated: When he makes that gross, greed associated with the kinds of direct knowledge arises. Conascence, decisive-support,

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ

translated: The six

analyzed: katvā gantha sampayuttakā khandhāḥ uppajjanti mūlā pucchitabbā diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagate  khandhe ca lobhañca garum katvā diṭṭhi gata vippayuttaḥ lobho uppajjati mūlā pucchitabbā  diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagate khandhe ca lobhañca garum katvā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā
translated: Having made them the condition, the aggregates that are connected to the fetters arise. (The roots should be asked about.)🔽When, having made the aggregates that are connected to greed but not to the false views, and greed, the decisive support, the greed that is not connected to the false views arises. (The roots should be asked about.)

original: khandhā ca lobho ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: khandhā ca lobhaḥ ca uppajjanti
translated: When, having made the aggregates that are connected to greed but not to the false views, and greed, the decisive support, the aggregates that are connected to greed but not to the false views, and greed arise.

original: Anantara🔽Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā🔽purimā ganthasampayuttā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ ganthasampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlā pucchitabbā) Purimā purimā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā
analyzed: anantara  gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayopurimā  purimāḥ gantha sampayuttā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam gantha sampayuttakānam khandhānam  anantara paccayena paccayaḥ mūlā pucchitabbā purimā purimā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā
translated: Immediately preceding condition

original: khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa diṭṭhigatavippayuttassa lobhassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa diṭṭhigata vippayuttassa lobhassa anantara paccayena
translated: A factor that is connected to the fetters is an immediately preceding condition for a factor that is connected to the fetters: preceding and immediately preceding aggregates that are connected to the fetters are an immediately preceding condition for succeeding and immediately succeeding aggregates that are connected to the fetters. (The roots should be asked about.) Preceding and immediately preceding aggregates that are connected to greed but not to the false views are an immediately preceding condition for succeeding and immediately succeeding greed that is not connected to the false views.

original: paccayo; purimā purimā domanassasahagatā khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa paṭighassa🔽anantarapaccayena paccayo; ganthasampayuttā khandhā vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ purimā purimā domanassa sahagatāḥ khandhāḥ pacchimassa pacchimassa paṭighassa  anantara paccayena paccayaḥ gantha sampayuttāḥ khandhāḥ vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena
translated: preceding states are conditions, as proximity condition, for succeeding states of repulsion.🔽The aggregates that are associated with the fetters are a condition, as proximity condition, for the emergence from the attainment.

original: paccayo. (Mūlā pucchitabbā) Purimā purimā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā🔽pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ lobhassa🔽ca anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimā purimā domanassasahagatā khandhā pacchimānaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ mūlā pucchitabbā purimā purimā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā  pacchimānam pacchimānam diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam khandhānam lobhassa  ca anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimāḥ domanassa sahagatāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: (The root should be asked about.) The preceding states that are associated with greed and are not associated with false view🔽are a condition, as proximity condition, for the succeeding states that are associated with greed and are not associated with false view, and for greed.

original: pacchimānaṁ domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimo
analyzed: pacchimānam domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimaḥ
translated: The preceding states that are associated with grief and are not associated with false view are a condition, as proximity condition, for the succeeding states that are associated with grief and are not associated with false view, and for repulsion.

original: purimo diṭṭhigatavippayutto lobho pacchimassa pacchimassa diṭṭhigatavippayuttassa
analyzed: purimaḥ diṭṭhigata vippayuttaḥ lobho pacchimassa pacchimassa diṭṭhigata vippayuttassa
translated: A state that is unconnected with the fetters is a condition, as proximity condition, for a state that is unconnected with the fetters. The preceding greed that is not associated with false view is a condition, as proximity condition, for the succeeding greed that is not associated with false view.

original: lobhassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimaṁ purimaṁ paṭighaṁ pacchimassa pacchimassa🔽paṭighassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimā purimā ganthavippayuttā khandhā pacchimānaṁ🔽pacchimānaṁ ganthavippayuttānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; anulomaṁ gotrabhussa🔽…pe… phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: lobhassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimam purimam paṭigham pacchimassa pacchimassa  paṭighassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimāḥ purimāḥ gantha vippayuttāḥ khandhāḥ  pacchimānam gantha vippayuttānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa  pe phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: Greed is a condition, as an proximity condition, for the states of ill will.🔽Each preceding state of resentment is a condition, as a proximity condition, for each succeeding state of resentment.🔽The preceding aggregates that are not linked to the knots are a condition, as a proximity condition, for the succeeding aggregates that are not linked to the knots.🔽The conformity is a condition, as a proximity condition, for the change-of-lineage.🔽… is a condition, as a proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit.🔽🔽

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimo🔽purimo diṭṭhigatavippayutto lobho pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimaṁ purimaṁ paṭighaṁ pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ🔽domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; āvajjanā ganthasampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimaḥ 🔽purimaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayuttaḥ lobho pacchimānam pacchimānam diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam 🔽khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimam purimam paṭigham pacchimānam pacchimāna 🔽domanassa sahagatānaṃ khandhānaṃ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ āvajjanā gantha sampayuttakāna
translated: A preceding greed is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for a succeeding greed. A preceding aversion is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for a succeeding aversion. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for succeeding wholesome thoughts. Preceding unwholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for succeeding unwholesome thoughts. Preceding thoughts that are undetermined are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for succeeding thoughts that are undetermined. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit of once-returning. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit of non-returning. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit of perfection. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the state of a once-returner. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the state of a non-returner. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the state of perfection. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the state of perfection. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the state of perfection. Preceding wholesome thoughts are a condition

original: khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the aggregates.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo—purimo purimo diṭṭhigatavippayutto lobho pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimaṁ purimaṁ paṭighaṁ pacchimānaṁ
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa anantara paccayena  paccayo purimaḥ purimaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayuttaḥ lobho pacchimānam pacchimānam diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam  khandhānam lobhassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimam purimam paṭigham
translated: A state that is unconnected with the knots is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is connected with the knots and for a state that is unconnected with the knots.🔽A preceding state that is unconnected with the false views is a condition, as proximate condition, for a following state that is connected with greed and for the aggregates that are associated with greed and for greed.

original: pacchimānaṁ domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: pacchimānam domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A preceding state that is unconnected with resentment is a condition, as proximate condition, for a following state that is associated with grief and for the aggregates that are associated with grief and for resentment.

original: āvajjanā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca domanassasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: āvajjanā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam khandhānam lobhassa ca domanassa sahagatāna  khandhānam paṭighassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Attention is a condition, as proximate condition, for the aggregates that are connected with greed and for greed and for the aggregates that are associated with grief and for resentment.

original: Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayutto ca dhammā gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa anantara paccayena
translated: A state that is connected with the knots and a state that is unconnected with the knots are a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is connected with the knots.

original: paccayo—purimā purimā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca pacchimānaṁ🔽pacchimānaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo;🔽purimā purimā domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ domanassasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlā pucchitabbā) Purimā purimā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā
analyzed: paccayopurimā purimā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca pacchimāna  pacchimānam diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  purimā purimā domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca pacchimānam pacchimānam domanassa sahagatāna  khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ mūlā pucchitabbā purimā purimā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā
translated: Condition: The preceding and past aggregates associated with attachment and attachment are a condition, as proximate condition, for the succeeding and later aggregates associated with attachment and attachment.🔽The preceding and past aggregates associated with grief and resentment are a condition, as proximate condition, for the succeeding and later aggregates associated with grief and resentment. (The roots should be asked about.) The preceding and past aggregates associated with attachment and attachment and attachment are a condition, as proximate condition, for the succeeding and later aggregates not associated with views and attachment.

original: khandhā ca lobho ca pacchimassa pacchimassa diṭṭhigatavippayuttassa lobhassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: khandhā ca lobho ca pacchimassa pacchimassa diṭṭhigata vippayuttassa lobhassa anantara paccayena
translated: The preceding and past aggregates associated with grief and resentment and resentment are a condition, as proximate condition, for the succeeding and later resentment. The aggregates associated with attachment and attachment not associated with views and attachment are a condition, as proximity condition, for the succeeding and later attachment not associated with views and attachment.

original: paccayo; purimā purimā domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca pacchimassa pacchimassa🔽paṭighassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca
analyzed: paccayo purimā purimā domanassa sahagatāḥ khandhāḥ ca paṭighañca pacchimassa pacchimassa 🔽paṭighassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagatāḥ khandhāḥ ca
translated: The preceding and past aggregates associated with grief and resentment and resentment are a condition, as proximity condition, for the succeeding and later resentment.

original: lobho ca domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽(Mūlā pucchitabbā) Purimā purimā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho🔽ca pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ lobhassa
analyzed: lobho ca domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighan ca vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena paccayo  mūlā pucchitabbā purimā purimā diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho  ca pacchimānam pacchimānam diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam khandhānam lobhassa
translated: and greed and the associated aggregates and repulsion are conditions, as an immediately preceding condition, for the arising of the first absorption.

original: ca anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimā purimā domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca🔽pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimā domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighan ca  pacchimānam pacchimānam domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: (The roots should be asked about.) The preceding greed-associated aggregates and greed are conditions, as an immediately preceding condition, for the succeeding greed-associated aggregates and greed; the preceding repulsion-associated aggregates and repulsion are conditions, as an immediately preceding condition, for the succeeding repulsion-associated aggregates and repulsion.

original: Samanantarādi
analyzed: samanantara ādi
translated: Conascence, etc.

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa samanantarapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor associated with the fetters is related to a factor associated with the fetters as a condition by way of conascence condition … by way of support condition.

original: Upanissaya
analyzed: upanissaya
translated: Condition by way of decisive support

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo
translated: A factor associated with a fetter is related to a factor associated with a fetter as decisive support condition, as object decisive support condition.

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—ganthasampayuttā khandhā
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ gantha sampayuttāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: A factor associated with the fetters is a condition, as decisive support condition, for a factor associated with the fetters. The decisive support condition is the object decisive support, the prior decisive support, and the natural decisive support. The natural decisive support is the associated aggregates.

original: ganthasampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ,🔽tīṇipi upanissayā.) Ganthasampayuttā khandhā ganthavippayuttānaṁ khandhānaṁ upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo. (Mūlaṁ, tīṇipi upanissayā.) Ganthasampayuttā khandhā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ
analyzed: gantha sampayuttakānam khandhānam upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam  upanissayāḥ gantha sampayuttāḥ khandhāḥ gantha vippayuttānam khandhānam upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ upanissayā gantha sampayuttā khandhā diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagatāna
translated: The associated aggregates are a condition, as decisive support condition, for the associated aggregates. (The root should be asked for.

original: khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: khandhānam lobhassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam
translated: All three decisive supports.) The associated aggregates are a condition, as decisive support condition, for the dissociated aggregates. (The root, all three decisive supports.) The associated aggregates are a condition, as decisive support condition, for the aggregates associated with false view, for greed associated with false view, and for the aggregates associated with grief.

original: paṭighassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paṭighassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: They are a condition, as decisive support condition, for the aggregates associated with aversion and for aversion.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo
translated: A factor not associated with the fetters is a condition, as decisive support condition, for a factor not associated with the fetters. The decisive support condition is the object decisive support, the prior decisive support, and the natural decisive support.

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ🔽deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti … mānaṁ jappeti … sīlaṁ …pe… paññaṁ … rāgaṁ … dosaṁ🔽… mohaṁ … mānaṁ … patthanaṁ … kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ … kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ … utuṁ … bhojanaṁ🔽… senāsanaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti … pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ🔽bhindati; saddhā …pe… paññā, rāgo …pe… patthanā …pe… senāsanaṁ saddhāya …pe… paññāya🔽… rāgassa … dosassa … mohassa … mānassa … patthanāya …pe… phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya mānaṁ🔽jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti; sīlaṁ …pe… paññaṁ … rāgaṁ …pe… mānaṁ … patthanaṁ …pe… senāsanaṁ
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ saddham upanissāya māna  jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti sīlam pe paññam rāgam pe mānam patthanam pe senāsana
translated: the preceding condition as object, the natural condition as object …🔽The natural condition as object: depending on faith, one generates conceit,🔽one grasps a view; depending on virtue … on learning … on generosity … on understanding, on greed … on hate … on delusion … on conceit … on insistence … on a dwelling place, one generates conceit,

original: upanissāya pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati; saddhā …pe… senāsanaṁ rāgassa … dosassa
analyzed: upanissāya pāṇam hanati pe saṅgham bhindati saddhā pe senāsanam rāgassa dosassa
translated: one grasps a view; depending on faith … on a dwelling place, one kills living beings … one causes a schism in the Sangha.🔽Faith … a dwelling place is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for greed, for hate,

original: … mohassa … mānassa … diṭṭhiyā … patthanāya upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mohassa mānassa diṭṭhiyāḥ patthanāya upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: for delusion, for conceit, for views, for insistence.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo (tīṇi upanissayā); saddhaṁ upanissāya mānaṁ jappeti; sīlaṁ …pe… paññaṁ …🔽rāgaṁ … dosaṁ … mohaṁ … mānaṁ … patthanaṁ … kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ …pe… senāsanaṁ upanissāya
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ tīṇi upanissayā saddham upanissāya mānam jappeti sīlam pe paññam  rāgam dosam moham mānam patthanam kāyikam sukham pe senāsanam upanissāya
translated: A factor that is unconnected with the bonds is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for a factor that is connected with the bonds and for a factor that is unconnected with the bonds.🔽(Three decisive support conditions.) Depending on faith, one generates conceit,🔽one grasps a view; depending on virtue … on learning … on generosity … on understanding, on greed … on hate … on delusion … on conceit … on insistence … on bodily pleasure … on a dwelling place, one kills living beings … one causes a schism in the Sangha.

original: pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati; saddhā …pe… paññā … rāgo … doso … moho … māno
analyzed: pāṇam hanati pe saṅgham bhindati saddhā pe paññā rāgaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ mānaḥ
translated: Depending on faith … on understanding, on greed … on hate … on delusion … on conceit …

original: … patthanā …pe… senāsanaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ lobhassa
analyzed: patthanā pe senāsanam diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam khandhānam lobhassa
translated: … Intention … … The requisites of a monk … The wholesome thoughts associated with greed that are related to the five hindrances, and greed,

original: ca domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: ca domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayutto ca dhammā gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: and the unwholesome thoughts associated with grief that are related to the five hindrances, and grief, are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the five hindrances.🔽A factor that is connected with the fetters and a factor that is unconnected with the fetters are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for a factor that is connected with the fetters.

original: paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā
analyzed: paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā
translated: The decisive support condition is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the wholesome thoughts associated with greed that are related to the five hindrances, and greed, and the unwholesome thoughts associated with grief that are related to the five hindrances, and grief, for the thoughts connected with the fetters.

original: khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca ganthasampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā
analyzed: khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighaṃ ca gantha sampayuttakāna  khandhānam upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā
translated: The wholesome thoughts associated with greed that are related to the five hindrances, and greed, and the unwholesome thoughts associated with grief that are related to the five hindrances, and grief, are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the thoughts unconnected with the fetters.

original: khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca ganthavippayuttānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā khandhā ca paṭighañca gantha vippayuttānam khandhānam
translated: The wholesome thoughts associated with greed that are related to the five hindrances, and greed, and the unwholesome thoughts associated with grief that are related to the five hindrances, and grief, are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the thoughts connected with the fetters.

original: diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhassa ca paṭighassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ
analyzed: diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobhassa ca paṭighassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūla
translated: and of aversion associated with false view, by way of decisive support condition. (The root🔽should be asked about.) The aggregates associated with greed not associated with false view, and greed, and the aggregates associated with grief🔽and aversion, are for the aggregates associated with greed not associated with false view and for greed

original: pucchitabbaṁ.) Diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā🔽khandhā ca paṭighañca diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca🔽domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā  khandhā ca paṭighañca diṭṭhigata vippayutta lobha sahagatānam khandhānam lobhassa ca  domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and for the aggregates associated with grief and for aversion, by way of decisive support condition.

original: Purejāta
analyzed: purā jāta
translated: Preceding🔽A phenomenon that is not a fetter is a condition, by way of preceding condition, for a phenomenon that is not a fetter—preceded condition,

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato vipassati, assādeti🔽abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha ganthavippayutto rāgo uppajjati, vicikicchā …pe… uddhaccaṁ
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccataḥ vipassati assādeti  abhinandati tam ārabbha gantha vippayuttaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati vicikicchā pe uddhacca
translated: preceded by way of object condition,

original: …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ
analyzed: pe domanassam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā sadda
translated: preceded by way of object condition: One considers as impermanent, as suffering, as a disease, as a tumour, as a barb, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as empty, as non-self, the eye … the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … the mind … the form … the sound … the odour … the flavour … the tangible … the mind-object … the eye-consciousness … the ear-consciousness … the nose-consciousness … the tongue-consciousness … the body-consciousness … the mind-consciousness … the eye-contact … the ear-contact … the nose-contact … the tongue-contact … the body-contact … the mind-contact … the feeling that arises because of eye-contact … the feeling that arises because of ear-contact … the feeling that arises because of nose-contact … the feeling that arises because of tongue-contact … the feeling that arises because of body-contact … the feeling that arises because of mind-contact … the perception that arises because of eye-contact … the perception that arises because of ear-contact … the perception that arises because of nose-contact … the perception that arises because of tongue-contact … the perception that arises because of body-contact … the perception that arises because of mind-contact … the volition that arises because of eye-contact … the volition that arises because of ear-contact … the volition that arises because of nose-contact … the volition that arises because of tongue-contact … the volition that arises because of body-contact … the volition that arises because of mind-contact … the craving that arises because of eye-contact … the craving that arises because of ear-contact … the craving that arises because of nose-contact … the craving that arises because of tongue-contact … the craving that arises because of body-contact … the craving that arises

original: suṇāti. Rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe….
analyzed: suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe
translated: He hears. The visible-form element is the object of eye-consciousness … the tangible-element is the object of body-consciousness …

original: Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe…
analyzed: vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe
translated: The visible-form element is a condition, as prenascence condition, for eye-consciousness … The tangible-object element is a condition, as prenascence condition, for body-consciousness …

original: vatthu ganthavippayuttānaṁ khandhānaṁ diṭṭhigatavippayuttassa lobhassa ca paṭighassa🔽ca purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vatthu gantha vippayuttānam khandhānam diṭṭhigata vippayuttassa lobhassa ca paṭighassa  ca purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The physical basis is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the aggregates that are not conjoined with knots and for the greed that is dissociated from false view and for the hate that is dissociated from false view.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ🔽ārabbha ganthasampayutto rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum assādeti abhinandati  ārabbha gantha sampayuttaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi pe domanassam uppajjati vatthu purejāta vatthu
translated: A state that is not conjoined with knots is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a state conjoined with knots: prenascence condition by way of object,

original: ganthasampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: gantha sampayuttakānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: prenascence condition by way of physical basis. Prenascence condition by way of object: the eye … the mind is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the greed that is conjoined with knots … for the hate that is conjoined with knots … for the false view that is conjoined with knots … for the conceit that is conjoined with knots … for the insistence that is conjoined with knots … for the greed that is conjoined with knots and is associated with false view … for the hate that is conjoined with knots and is associated with false view … for the delusion that is conjoined with knots and is associated with false view. Prenascence condition by way of physical basis: the physical basis is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the aggregates that are not conjoined with knots.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa purejātapaccayena
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa purejāta paccayena
translated: A factor that is not connected to the hindrances is a condition, as prior condition, for a factor that is connected to the hindrances and for a factor that is not connected to the hindrances.

original: paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ, vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ🔽ārabbha diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā khandhā🔽ca paṭighañca uppajjanti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatānaṁ
analyzed: paccayo ārammaṇa purejāta vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthu  ārabbha diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā khandhā  ca paṭighan ca uppajjanti vatthu purejāta vatthu diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatāna
translated: The condition being, as prior condition, the object condition and the support condition. As the object condition, the eye-base … the mind-base … the body-base …🔽The condition being, as prior condition, the support condition, the five aggregates that are connected to views and greed, and greed, and the five aggregates that are connected to grief and aversion, and aversion, arise in dependence on the body.

original: khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca domanassasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam lobhassa ca domanassa sahagatānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is not connected to the hindrances is a condition, as prior condition, for the five aggregates that are connected to views and greed, and for greed, and for the five aggregates that are connected to grief and aversion, and for aversion.

original: Pacchājāta🔽Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.
analyzed: pacchājāta  gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ eka
translated: As a subsequent condition🔽A factor that is connected to the hindrances is a condition, as a subsequent condition, for a factor that is not connected to the hindrances. … One …

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ eka
translated: A factor that is not connected to the hindrances is a condition, as a subsequent condition, for a factor that is not connected to the hindrances. … One …

original: Ganthasampayutto ca ganthavippayutto ca dhammā ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena🔽paccayo—pacchājātā diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassasahagatā
analyzed: gantha sampayutto ca gantha vippayutto ca dhammā gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena  paccaya upacchājātāḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā khandhā ca lobho ca domanassa sahagatā
translated: Factors associated with the hindrances and those dissociated from the hindrances are related to a state dissociated from the hindrances as a condition being prior and arisen before.

original: khandhā ca paṭighañca purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca paṭighañca purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: The aggregates associated with the fetters of views and with the fetter of aversion, and the fetter of aversion, are related to this prior material body as a condition being prior and arisen before.

original: Āsevana
analyzed: āsevana
translated: Habitual

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo. (Anantarasadisaṁ, āvajjanāpi vuṭṭhānampi natthi.)
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa āsevana paccayena paccayo anantara sadisaḥ āvajjanā api vuṭṭhānam pi natthi
translated: A state associated with the hindrances is related to a state associated with the hindrances as a condition being habitual. (The same as the condition being prior and arisen before, except that there is no condition being immediately prior.)

original: Kamma🔽Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— ganthasampayuttā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kamma  gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ gantha sampayuttā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Kamma🔽A state associated with the hindrances is related to a state associated with the hindrances as a condition being kamma. The volition associated with the hindrances is related to the associated aggregates as a condition being kamma.

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— sahajātā,
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sahajātā
translated: A state associated with the hindrances is related to a state dissociated from the hindrances as a condition being kamma. Conascent …

original: nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—ganthasampayuttā cetanā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena🔽paccayo; diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā cetanā lobhassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagatā cetanā paṭighassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: nānākkhaṇikā sahajāta āgantha sampayuttā cetanā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kamma paccayena  paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā cetanā lobhassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca  rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagatā cetanā paṭighassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānam ca
translated: are of different times. Conascent means: volition associated with the fetters is related to materiality originated by consciousness as kamma-result by way of kamma-result condition.🔽Volition associated with greed that is dissociated from false view is related to greed and to materiality originated by consciousness as kamma-result by way of kamma-result condition.🔽Volition associated with grief is related to resentment and to materiality originated by consciousness as kamma-result by way of kamma-result condition.

original: rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—ganthasampayuttā cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānā kkhaṇikā gantha sampayuttā cetanā vipākānam khandhānam  kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Volition associated with the fetters is related to resultant aggregates and to materiality due to kamma performed by way of kamma-result condition.

original: Ganthasampayutto dhammo ganthasampayuttassa ca ganthavippayuttassa ca dhammassa kammapaccayena🔽paccayo—ganthasampayuttā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ
analyzed: gantha sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha sampayuttassa ca gantha vippayuttassa ca dhammassa kamma paccayena  paccayogantha sampayuttā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ
translated: A state associated with the fetters is related to a state associated with the fetters and to a state not associated with the fetters as kamma-result by way of kamma-result condition.

original: kammapaccayena paccayo; diṭṭhigatavippayuttalobhasahagatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: kamma paccayena paccayaḥ diṭṭhi gata vippayutta lobha sahagatā cetanā
translated: Volition associated with the fetters is related to associated aggregates and to materiality originated by consciousness as kamma-result by way of kamma-result condition.🔽Volition associated with greed that is dissociated from false view is related to associated aggregates and to materiality originated by consciousness as kamma-result by way of kamma-result condition.

original: khandhānaṁ lobhassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; domanassasahagatā🔽cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ paṭighassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam lobhassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ domanassa sahagatā  cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam paṭighassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state unassociated with the fetters is a condition, as kamma condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness associated with grief.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— sahajātā,
analyzed: gantha vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ gantha vippayuttassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sahajātā
translated: A state unassociated with the kinds of clinging is a condition, as kamma condition, for a state unassociated with the kinds of clinging, being conascent …🔽and being at a different time … .🔽A state unassociated with the kinds of clinging is a condition, as kamma condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness associated with the kinds of clinging.

original: nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—ganthavippayuttā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—ganthavippayuttā🔽cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Vipākādi
analyzed: nānā khaṇikā sahajāta āgantha vippayuttā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe nānā kkhaṇika āgantha vippayuttā  cetanā vipākānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  vipāka ādi
translated: Resultant, etc.

original: Ganthavippayutto dhammo ganthavippayuttassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.
